etch.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to cut lines on a metal plate, piece of glass, stone etc to form a picture or words
etch.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: A laser is used to etch a pattern in the smooth surface of the disc.
a gravestone with three names etched on it
etch.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if someoneâ€™s face is etched with pain, sadness etc, you can see these feelings from their expression
etch.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Craig saw lines of pain etched around her mouth.
Her face was etched with tiredness.
etch.translation[0].definitions[1].note_: Etch is usually passive in this meaning
etch.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to make lines or patterns appear on something very clearly
